class.name: derez.libs.Magnetics
class.comment:
MagneticData provides information about the magnetic parameters in a location defined by its Latitude, Longitude and Altitude coordinates. Methods:
Initialize - initializes the object by reading parameters from a file. The file “WMMC.COF” must be located at the directory "Magnetics" under the "Root external" Dir. The file is valid for the period 2010 - 2015. For later use a new file should be prepared from data found in this site: http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/geomag/WMM/soft.shtml , where the algorithm is taken from.
MAGNETICDATA (LAT As Double, LON As Double, ALT As Double) As String[] Lat and LON are in degrees, East and North positive. Alt in Km above sea level or the WGS84 ellipsoid. The method returns an array of three parameters: -Magnetic Declination (or Variation) -Magnetic Inclination -Grid Variation - for Lat above 55 degrees or below -55 degrees. For other cases it returns -999.
SETDATE (Day As Int, Month As Int, Year As Int) The library is taking today's date as a default. If you need calculation for another date - use this method.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the object by reading parameters from a file. The file “WMMC.COF” must be located at the directory "Magnetics" under the "Root external" Dir. The file is valid for the period 2010 - 2015. For later use a new file should be prepared from data found in this site: http://www.ngdc.noaa.gov/geomag/WMM/soft.shtml , where the algorithm is taken from.

method.name: MagneticData
method.comment: Lat and LON are in degrees, East and North positive. Alt in Km above sea level or the WGS84 ellipsoid. The method returns an array of three parameters: -Magnetic Declination (or Variation) -Magnetic Inclination -Grid Variation - for Lat above 55 degrees or below -55 degrees. For other cases it returns -999.

method.name: SetDate
method.comment: The library is taking today's date as a default. If you need calculation for another date - use this method.
